title.rendered: The highest paid players in the world

content.rendered:
The season is entering its final stretch. Over the last few weeks, different media have been revealing the players whose chips are the highest in the most important championships on our continent. Today it is the Marca newspaper that contributes its particular grain of sand and shows us the highest paid soccer players in Spain, France, Italy and Germany.

Follow after this ad

Taking this classification as a reference -which takes gross salaries as a reference- the player whose salary is the highest in the world is the Brazilian Neymar, who costs Paris Saint Germain a whopping €49 million a year. He is followed by his partner Lionel Messi with €40.5 million. The surprising third place goes to Gareth Bale, whose salary is no less than €34 million gross.

These are the 10 highest paid players in the world (raw amount)

– 1. Neymar (PSG) with a salary of €48.99 million

– 2. Leo Messi (PSG) with a salary of €40.5M

– 3. Gareth Bale (Real Madrid) with a salary of €34M

– 4. Cristiano Ronaldo (Manchester United) with a salary of €31.5M

– 5. Antoine Griezmann (Atletico de Madrid) with a salary of €30M

– 6. Eden Hazard (Real Madrid) with a salary of €30M

– 7. Kylian Mbappé (PSG) with a salary of €26.4M

– 8. Kevin de Bruyne (Manchester City) with a salary of €24.7M

– 9. Karim Benzema (Real Madrid) with a salary of €24M

– 10. David de Gea (Manchester United) with a salary of €23.3M

Others

– 12. Sergio Busquets (FC Barcelona) with a salary of €23M

– 13. Toni Kroos (Real Madrid) with a salary of €22M

– 21. Jordi Alba (FC Barcelona) with a salary of €20M

– 21. Jan Oblak (Atletico de Madrid) with a salary of €20M

– 21. David Alaba (Real Madrid) with a salary of €20M

– 21. Luka Modric (Real Madrid) with a salary of €20M
